segment.source: Server Groups Node
segment.target: Server Groups Node

segment.source: Server Groups Node
segment.target: Server Groups Node

segment.source: Server Groups Node
segment.target: Server Groups Node

segment.source: The Server Groups node is one level below the Application Virtualization System node in the Scope pane in the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.
segment.target: The Server Groups node is one level below the Application Virtualization System node in the Scope pane in the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.

segment.source: When you select this node, the Results pane displays a list of server groups.
segment.target: When you select this node, the Results pane displays a list of server groups.

segment.source: Right-click the node to display a pop-up menu that contains the following elements.
segment.target: Right-click the node to display a pop-up menu that contains the following elements.

segment.source: New Server Group
segment.target: New Server Group

segment.source: Displays the New Server Group Wizard.
segment.target: Displays the New Server Group Wizard.

segment.source: This wizard consists of a single page, where you can specify a name for the server group in the Server Group Name field and then select the default provider policy from the drop-down menu of available provider policies.
segment.target: This wizard consists of a single page, where you can specify a name for the server group in the Server Group Name field and then select the default provider policy from the drop-down menu of available provider policies.

segment.source: Select the Enable check box to enable the server group.
segment.target: Select the Enable check box to enable the server group.

segment.source: Click Finish to add the new server group.
segment.target: Click Finish to add the new server group.

segment.source: View
segment.target: View

segment.source: Changes the appearance and content of the Results pane.
segment.target: Changes the appearance and content of the Results pane.

segment.source: New Window from Here
segment.target: New Window from Here

segment.source: Opens a new management console with the selected node as the root node.
segment.target: Opens a new management console with the selected node as the root node.

segment.source: Refresh
segment.target: Refresh

segment.source: Refreshes the view of the server.
segment.target: Refreshes the view of the server.

segment.source: Export List
segment.target: Export List

segment.source: Creates a tab-delimited text file that contains the contents of the Results pane.
segment.target: Creates a tab-delimited text file that contains the contents of the Results pane.

segment.source: This item displays a standard File Save dialog box where you specify the location for the text file you are creating.
segment.target: This item displays a standard File Save dialog box where you specify the location for the text file you are creating.

segment.source: Help
segment.target: Help

segment.source: Displays the help system for the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.
segment.target: Displays the help system for the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.

segment.source: If you click any server group that appears under the Server Groups node in the Scope pane, the following elements are available.
segment.target: If you click any server group that appears under the Server Groups node in the Scope pane, the following elements are available.

segment.source: New Virtual Application Server
segment.target: New Virtual Application Server

segment.source: Displays the New Virtual Application Server Wizard.
segment.target: Displays the New Virtual Application Server Wizard.

segment.source: Use this wizard to add a new Application Virtualization Management Server.
segment.target: Use this wizard to add a new Application Virtualization Management Server.

segment.source: This wizard has one page, in which you specify the server name in the Display Name field and enter a name in the DNS Host Name field.
segment.target: This wizard has one page, in which you specify the server name in the Display Name field and enter a name in the DNS Host Name field.

segment.source: From this wizard, you can also specify a value for the server cache in the Maximum Memory Allocation (MB) field and a value for the threshold warning level in the Warn Memory Allocation (MB) field.
segment.target: From this wizard, you can also specify a value for the server cache in the Maximum Memory Allocation (MB) field and a value for the threshold warning level in the Warn Memory Allocation (MB) field.

segment.source: New Window from Here
segment.target: New Window from Here

segment.source: Opens a new management console with the selected node as the root node.
segment.target: Opens a new management console with the selected node as the root node.

segment.source: Delete
segment.target: Delete

segment.source: Deletes a package from the Results pane.
segment.target: Deletes a package from the Results pane.

segment.source: Rename
segment.target: Rename

segment.source: Changes the name of a package in the Results pane.
segment.target: Changes the name of a package in the Results pane.

segment.source: Refresh
segment.target: Refresh

segment.source: Refreshes the view of the server.
segment.target: Refreshes the view of the server.

segment.source: Properties
segment.target: Properties

segment.source: Displays the Properties dialog box for the selected server group.
segment.target: Displays the Properties dialog box for the selected server group.

segment.source: The Properties dialog box has the following tabs:
segment.target: The Properties dialog box has the following tabs:

segment.source: General—Enables you to select the provider policy from the drop-down list of Provider Policies.
segment.target: General—Enables you to select the provider policy from the drop-down list of Provider Policies.

segment.source: You can also enable or disable the server by selecting or clearing the Enable check box.
segment.target: You can also enable or disable the server by selecting or clearing the Enable check box.

segment.source: Logging—Enables you to add, edit, and remove logging modules.
segment.target: Logging—Enables you to add, edit, and remove logging modules.

segment.source: When you add or edit a logging module, you can also set or change the logging level.
segment.target: When you add or edit a logging module, you can also set or change the logging level.

segment.source: Applications—Lists the applications that are associated with the selected server group.
segment.target: Applications—Lists the applications that are associated with the selected server group.

segment.source: The displayed information includes the application name, version number, and enable status.
segment.target: The displayed information includes the application name, version number, and enable status.

segment.source: Help
segment.target: Help

segment.source: Displays the help system for the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.
segment.target: Displays the help system for the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: How to Manage Servers in the Server Management Console
